meanings.definition: The ability of an organism to synthesize all necessary organic compounds for growth and reproduction.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, the prototrophy of the plants allows them to thrive without needing external nutrients.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the prototrophy of certain bacteria to understand how they can survive in extreme environments.
meanings.sent3: The prototrophy of the algae was so impressive that even the neighboring fish were jealous!
meanings.sent4: Her prototrophy in problem-solving made her the go-to person in the team.
meanings.sent5: The prototrophy of the bees in making honey showcases their incredible efficiency.

meanings.definition: The state of being a prototroph.
meanings.sent1: After the genetic modification, the mouse exhibited prototrophy and was able to thrive in the new environment.
meanings.sent2: The prototrophy of the cells was evident in their ability to grow rapidly in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The prototrophy of the superhero allowed him to adapt to any situation effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: His prototrophy in leadership made him a natural choice for the position.
meanings.sent5: The prototrophy of the plant in absorbing sunlight was truly remarkable.
